body: I tried in private navigation from an older release (november 27th) and it worked, maybe it will work with the last release too. Maybe deleting the cache would help

yes, there seems to be an issue connecting the front with the databases, with any config, pip install, docker, docker-compose, if you add a user via admin and put it in a project, that user can't log-in? admin breaks stuff, even the admin fails to log in after changing rights, I've been doing different type of container configurations, they all end up bugging the same. You can however work with it if you learn to identify what option breaks what

## The way to reproduce the problem

1. run doccano.
2. access http://{IPADDR}:{PORT}/admin/
3. log in to the admin site via a user(e.g. username: admin, password: password)
4. access http://{IPADDR}:{PORT}/auth
5. try to log in with the user credentials
6. return 403 error

## The cause I doubt

- Admin site uses session authentication
- doccano uses token authentication
- Session authentication has a higher priority than token authentication

https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/69f8bce9d4fb7f147e0098a8984b5264b656ef8e/app/app/settings.py#L246-L249

- Once we log in to the admin site, the `sessionid` and `csrftoken` are stored in the cookies.

![](https://i.gyazo.com/ba88b56a88ddd3c87b879e62e445cce9.png)

If we try to log in to doccano in the state `sessionid` is stored in the cookies, the username and password are not used because the app tries to authenticate the user by session authentication. That's why the app returns 403.

Same issue when I deployed to Azure WebApp and Google Cloud Run. As Azure Webapp deployment is in docker compose format, and Azure does not support logging, not sure how to investigate that one. 
For GCP deployment, I got :
```
ImportError: cannot import name 'ExpiredSignature' from 'jwt' (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/jwt/__init__.py)
at <module> (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/social_core/backends/azuread_tenant.py:6)
at _call_with_frames_removed (<frozen importlib._bootstrap>:219)
at exec_module (<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>:783)
at _load_unlocked (<frozen importlib._bootstrap>:671)
at _find_and_load_unlocked (<frozen importlib._bootstrap>:975)
at _find_and_load (<frozen importlib._bootstrap>:991)
at _gcd_import (<frozen importlib._bootstrap>:1014)
at import_module (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/importlib/__init__.py:127)
at import_string (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/utils/module_loading.py:17)
at load_backend (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/contrib/auth/__init__.py:21)
at _get_backends (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/contrib/auth/__init__.py:27)
at authenticate (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/contrib/auth/__init__.py:66)
at validate (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/rest_framework/authtoken/serializers.py:20)
at run_validation (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/rest_framework/serializers.py:433)
at is_valid (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/rest_framework/serializers.py:235)
at view (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/views/generic/base.py:71)
at wrapped_view (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/views/decorators/csrf.py:54)
at _get_response (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py:113)
at _get_response (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py:115)
at inner (/usr/local/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py:34)``` 

```
As one of the suggestions was to downgrade pyjwt to 1.6.1, which failed the build:

```
Step #0 - "Build": ERROR: Cannot install PyJWT==1.6.1 and social-auth-core[azuread,openidconnect]==3.3.3 because these package versions have conflicting dependencies.
Step #0 - "Build": 
Step #0 - "Build": The conflict is caused by:
Step #0 - "Build":     The user requested PyJWT==1.6.1
Step #0 - "Build":     social-auth-core[azuread,openidconnect] 3.3.3 depends on pyjwt>=1.7.1; extra == "openidconnect"
```

rename.to: Deployment to cloud platform (Azure WebApp / Google Cloud Run/ Heroku) causes Request failed with status code 403

issue.title: Known issue about Page Access

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you can't reach the page or faced strange navigation**  
**If you faced the following issue, please upvote 👍 related issue that let us judge priority .**

- [x] Can' access the page
  - [x] [Bug report] Annotator doesn't see the project #822
  - [x]  Deployment to cloud platform (Azure WebApp / Google Cloud Run/ Heroku) causes Request failed with status code 403 #1098


### Our correspondence

1. Make clear access control by role.
2. Make a clear concept of 404/403 navigation.
3. Make a clear recovery path from 404/403 page.

issue.title: Can't login to Doccano using any other user than admin while loggin into the user portal

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

I open two tabs on a browser. On first browser I Login using admin credentials on the Django Administration portal. Now I created a new user. Using this new user credentials if I login to doccano portal while already logged in to the Admin portal, it fails to login. 

I'm required to logout from the Django Administration portal and then only I can login using the new credentials.

Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Mac and Chrome
*   Python Version Used: 3.7
*   When you install doccano: 1 month ago
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Our own ec2

Django Administration portal:
![Screenshot 2021-01-13 at 16 05 33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11743805/104442799-98754680-55bb-11eb-9fd9-3d2eb8e9051e.jpg)

At the same time, doccano portal,
![Screenshot 2021-01-13 at 16 05 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11743805/104442830-a2974500-55bb-11eb-8cff-d880a610119c.jpg)

issue.title: Can annotate while logged in administration protal

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

1.  Login to a user other than admin
2. Login to administration portal using admin
3. Go to previous user and try annotating

Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Mac and Chrome
*   Python Version Used: 3.7
*   When you install doccano: 1 month ago
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): AWS ec2

Admin portal,
![Screenshot 2021-01-13 at 16 28 01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11743805/104447859-63b8bd80-55c2-11eb-8d7a-e82439afc427.jpg)

Error in another user (other than admin) portal,
![Screenshot 2021-01-13 at 16 27 50](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11743805/104447934-7fbc5f00-55c2-11eb-83a6-aa94cc7a7e96.jpg)

issue.title: Replace TokenAuthentication with SessionAuthentication

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
To resolve auth problem after one logged in to the admin page, I replace TokenAuthentication with SessionAuthentication.

fix https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1220
fix https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1149
fix https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1148
fix https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1098
fix https://github.com/doccano/doccano/issues/1084
